page.title: 04LIME QUARRY
page.content: The lime quarry was opened in 1830 when the Southampton to Andover Canal was dug. It was owned by the canal company with the lime used for the construction of the canal. When the Andover to Southampton railway was built, much of the canal was filled in and the railway laid on top. The lime quarry was bought from the railways when the line closed in the 1960s, by a private contractor. At present 1000 _ 1500 tons of lime is extracted each year. Most is used as a base for road_works, some for agricultural use. Some of the flints in the chalk are used for wall building. The chalk used to be blasted out; as this is no longer allowed a 360 degrees hydraulic slew machine is used which has a metre cut.
